metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6962 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in apng2gif 1.7. There is an integer overflowresulting in a heap-based buffer overflow. This is related to theread_chunk function making an unchecked addition of 12.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6962` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apng2gif - 1.8-0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apng2gif package in esm-apps/jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8-0.1').
